narrative.narrative: Cathay Pacific Cargo is the cargo division of the largest airline based in Hong Kong, Cathay Pacific. The cargo division was founded in 1981 and they first flew a twice a week Hong Kong-Frankfurt-London route jointly with Lufthansa. They have had 10 707-320C's and 12 747-200F's. Their current fleet is 13 747-8F's with 1 on order, 6 747-400ERF's, and 5 747-400F's. They serve 40 destinations around the world in the cargo unit alone which includes many the passenger sector doesn't serve, combined they serve more than 80 destinations. They are the forth largest cargo airline in terms of freight tonne-kilometres flown as of 2012 at 8,433 million. They also handle most of the airlines passengers cargo.
